intro: Lhotskya genethylloides var. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteose bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
